Explanation:
The analyzed file appears to belong to the Lokibot malware family, characterized by its information-stealing capabilities. Detection statistics indicate that 59 antivirus engines have flagged this file as malicious, utilizing terms such as "Trojan.Multi.Generic," "Gen:Heur.PonyStealer," and "Backdoor.Win32.Androm." The analysis provides an association with a known network trojan, indicating high alert severity for outbound connections and command and control activity primarily linked to the URL http://corvette-engines.com/js/fre.php (IP: 192.124.249.162).

Sandbox analysis under platforms such as Zenbox and Lastline classifies the file as malware with specific Trojan and information-stealing behavior. While no specific MITRE ATT&CK tactics were detailed, the malicious attributes align with credential theft and data exfiltration activities commonly associated with Lokibot. As a precaution, organizations are advised to employ updated antivirus solutions, monitor outgoing data traffic, enforce strong access controls, and educate users about phishing tactics to mitigate potential risks associated with this malware. Implementing network segmentation and maintaining regular backup processes can also serve as effective countermeasures.
